content.question: Which of the following long-term developments in the twentieth century most influenced the passage of new immigration laws in 1965 ?

choices.label: The increased international and domestic pressures for the United States to remove discriminatory barriers
The increase in nativist sentiment against the arrival of migrants from eastern and southern Europe
The increase in opposition to hiring foreign workers during an economic downturn
The growth of isolationism in response to international tensions that threatened global conflict

content.answer: The increased international and domestic pressures for the United States to remove discriminatory barriers

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
